<title level="1" pfs="">[Creeping Crone](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2052)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Hags are neither immortal nor unageing; if not slain by an enemy, a hag eventually succumbs to old age. A hag who dies in agony or rage can rise again as a [witchfire](/Monsters.aspx?ID=860), while those who die of old age might rise again as an undead creature known as a creeping crone. A creeping crone has lost far more than her life; they can't form or join covens, denying them one of a living hag's most distinguishing abilities. This inability, more than their rotting bodies or hunger for flesh, makes creeping crones exiled among their former kin.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 33

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 31

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 28
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/CreepingCrone.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 11">[Creeping Crone](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2052)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 82</row>

**Perception** +21; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +22, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +21, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +21, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +22, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +20

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +3

**Con** +3

**Int** +5

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +6
</row>

**Items**
walking stick

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 30 

**Fort** +21 

**Ref** +18 

**Will** +24 

</row>

**HP** 210
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Stick Support** If a creeping crone is deprived of her walking stick, her Speed is reduced to 5 feet (though she can use some other Speed she gains, such as from her [_fly_](/Spells.aspx?ID=125) spell) until she recovers her walking stick or fashions another.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_walking stick_ +24 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [two-hand d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=198)),
**Damage** 2d4+12 bludgeoning plus 2d6 evil

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +22 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 2d8+12 slashing

**Occult Prepared Spells** DC 30, attack +22
- **Cantrips (6th)**
[Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58), [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66), [Ghost Sound](/Spells.aspx?ID=132), [Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190), [Ray of Frost](/Spells.aspx?ID=245)
- **1st**
[Bane](/Spells.aspx?ID=18), [Mindlink](/Spells.aspx?ID=195), [Ray of Enfeeblement](/Spells.aspx?ID=244), [Unseen Servant](/Spells.aspx?ID=352)
- **2nd**
[Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164), [Pass Without Trace](/Spells.aspx?ID=215), [Tree Shape](/Spells.aspx?ID=342)
- **3rd**
[Dream Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=90), [Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=104), [Paralyze](/Spells.aspx?ID=213), [Wall of Wind](/Spells.aspx?ID=367)
- **4th**
[Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125), [Nightmare](/Spells.aspx?ID=208), [Read Omens](/Spells.aspx?ID=247), [Talking Corpse](/Spells.aspx?ID=329)
- **5th**
[Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48), [Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271), [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340)
- **6th**
[Ice Storm](/Spells.aspx?ID=695), [Lightning Bolt](/Spells.aspx?ID=172), [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180)

**Change Shape** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The creeping crone can take on the appearance of any Medium [humanoid](/Traits.aspx?ID=91) woman, changing her walking stick to suit her new appearance. This doesn't change her Speed or Strikes, but it might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

**Discipline the Righteous** <actions string="Reaction" />  **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** The creeping crone critically hits a good creature with her walking stick **Strike**; Effect The target takes 2d8 [bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) damage.

**Walking Stick**   A creeping crone can spend 1 day enchanting her walking stick with the powers of a _+2 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [greater staff of necromancy](/Equipment.aspx?ID=360)_. A crone replaces any material component of an occult spell she casts by using the walking stick as a focus component instead. The walking stick's magic functions only for the crone who created it; for anyone else, it's a mundane stick. If the crone enchants a new walking stick, the previous stick loses all its powers.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Night Hags</title>

For some reason, [night hags](/Monsters.aspx?ID=257) never become creeping crones after they die. Although this is probably due to the protection provided by their heartstones, it might also be a side effect of long years of soul-trading in the foulest pits of the evil planes. Some stain lingers on night hags, whisking away their souls upon death so they're unable to rise as undead. Perhaps night hags can't resist making a bargain with their own souls and, upon their deaths, this payment becomes due.
</aside>
